derivation.yuyuan_name: Second World War (originally US): formed on the pattern of bridgehead

entry.tran: 滩头阵地；登陆场；滩头堡
entry.def: A beachhead is an area of land next to the sea or a river where an attacking force has taken control and can prepare to advance further inland.

means.word_mean: 1. a bridgehead on the enemy's shoreline seized by an amphibious operation;

sentences.sentence: "the Germans were desperately trying to contain the Anzio beachhead"

means.word_mean: 2. an initial accomplishment that opens the way for further developments;
